Scatterer's framerate just depends on what configs you're using for it. They usually go together because people who are making planet packs want them to have atmospheric effects (same with <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr>). If nothing's changed, the biggest framerate guzzler is usually scatterer's water shader. I've always thought it'd be nice if KS3P, Scatterer, and <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr> would get combined into a joint mod. KS3P adds in the stock Unity post-process shaders that SQUAD pulled out, and Scatterer is the KSP version of a Unity port of Proland.

[@blackrack](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/104258-blackrack/) This reminds me: have you checked out Scrawk's new/old/revised ocean shader to see if it performs better? [https://github.com/Scrawk/Ceto](https://github.com/Scrawk/Ceto)
